text:
Why did the lorry driver
start turning so late?
Video.

options.A: Because the lorry set off too fast
options.B: Because the lorry needs the room to turn
options.C: Because the driver was late checking their right mirror
options.D: Because the driver was making room for the cyclist

explanation: Because the lorry needs the room to turn. Large vehicles like lorries need to take a wide path when turning due to their size and turning circle.

text:
When may you wait in the
area marked with a cycle?
Video.

options.A: When you've checked your mirrors for cyclists
options.B: When there are no cycles in the marked area
options.C: When you've turned on your hazard warning lights
options.D: When the traffic lights change to amber after you've passed the first line

explanation: They passed too close to the cyclist. The car didn't leave enough safe passing distance when overtaking the cyclist.

text:
What hazard do you need
to look out for as you drive
under the bridge?
Video.

options.A: Pedestrians walking in the road
options.B: Overhanging tree branches
options.C: A narrowing of the road
options.D: The height of the bridge

explanation: The cyclist was trying to turn right. The cyclist was positioning themselves to turn right at the junction.

text:
What's the speed limit on
this road?
Video.

options.A: 30 mph
options.B: 40 mph
options.C: 50 mph
options.D: 60 mph

explanation: The pedestrian stepped into the road. The pedestrian crossed without looking properly for approaching traffic.

text:
What does the single
yellow line along the side of
the road mean?
Video.

options.A: Waiting restrictions apply at certain times
options.B: No waiting at any time
options.C: No stopping at any time
options.D: It marks the edge of the road

explanation: There could be pedestrians crossing. At crossings with no lights visible, pedestrians may be crossing and have right of way.

text:
What's the speed limit for
the car towing the caravan
on this road?
Video.

options.A: 70 mph
options.B: 40 mph
options.C: 50 mph
options.D: 60 mph

explanation: Check mirrors and signal right. Before moving out to overtake, you must check mirrors and signal your intention.

text:
The caravan starts to
swing from side to side.
What should the driver do to
bring it back under control?
Video.

options.A: Accelerate until the swinging stops
options.B: Brake firmly until the swinging stops
options.C: Steer sharply in the opposite direction to the caravan's swing
options.D: Ease off the accelerator to slow down

explanation: The rider was thrown over the handlebars. Emergency braking on a bicycle can cause the rider to go over the handlebars.

text:
Why is the caravan
unstable and swinging from
side to side?
Video.

options.A: Because the other cars are passing too close to it
options.B: Because of side winds
options.C: Because there are traffic cones on the road
options.D: Because it's in the wrong lane

explanation: The car pulled out without looking properly. The driver failed to check properly before pulling out from the junction.

text:
Why is there a warning
'Reduce speed now'?
Video.

options.A: There's a crossroads and a double bend ahead
options.B: There's a staggered junction ahead
options.C: There's a T-junction ahead
options.D: Traffic is merging from the left

explanation: Slow down and be prepared to stop. When approaching a junction with limited visibility, reduce speed and be ready to stop.

text:
Why has the line in the
centre of the road changed?
Video.

options.A: To warn of hazards ahead
options.B: To warn you there's a speed camera ahead
options.C: To warn you not to change lanes
options.D: To warn you the speed limit has changed

explanation: The motorcyclist was in the driver's blind spot. The car driver didn't see the motorcyclist because they were in a blind spot.

text:
The driver towing the
caravan wants to turn right
onto the dual carriageway.
What should they do?
Video.

options.A: Move out when an approaching driver flashes their headlights
options.B: Turn left and find a suitable place to turn around.
options.C: Move partly into the central reservation and wait until it's safe to turn
options.D: Wait until the road is clear in both directions before turning

explanation: Give way to the cyclist. When turning left, you must give way to cyclists going straight ahead on your left.

text:
What do the lines along
the centre of the road mean?
Video.

options.A: They mark the centre of the road
options.B: No stopping
options.C: No overtaking
options.D: There's a hazard ahead

explanation: The driver opened the door without checking. The driver should have checked for approaching traffic before opening the door.

text:
You want to overtake the
tractor. What should you
do?
Video.

options.A: Speed up and overtake before you get to the bend
options.B: Sound your horn and make the tractor pull over
options.C: Overtake straight after the oncoming car passes
options.D: Stay behind and wait until you have a clear view

explanation: Drop back to increase your view. Following too closely restricts your view of the road ahead.

text:
Why has the tractor got
flashing amber lights?
Video.

options.A: To warn you it's a slow- moving vehicle
options.B: To warn you it's breaking down
options.C: To tell you not to overtake
options.D: To warn you it has a wide load

explanation: Stop and allow them to cross. At a pedestrian crossing, you must stop when people are waiting to cross.

text:
Why should you take
care driving past the man
with the cane?
Video.

options.A: He's blind
options.B: He's physically disabled
options.C: He's deaf and blind
options.D: He's deaf

explanation: Check your blind spot before changing lanes. Always check blind spots before making lane changes, especially on motorways.

text:
How should you
approach the zebra
crossing?
Video.

options.A: Be ready to slow down or stop to allow pedestrians to cross
options.B: Sound your horn to warn the pedestrians
options.C: Speed up to get past the crossing
options.D: Slow down and wave the pedestrians across

explanation: The driver was driving too fast for the conditions. Speed should always be appropriate for road and traffic conditions.

text:
You've stopped at the
zebra crossing. When may
you move off?
Video.

options.A: When the pedestrians have cleared your side of the road
options.B: When the driver behind you sounds their horn
options.C: When the oncoming car moves off
options.D: When the pedestrians have completely crossed

explanation: Slow down and be ready to stop. When visibility is poor, reduce speed and be prepared for hazards.

text:
As you approach the roundabout, there's a sign showing a single white bar on a green background.
What does this sign tell you?
Video.

options.A: The roundabout is 50 yards ahead
options.B: The roundabout is 100 yards ahead
options.C: There are chevrons on the roundabout
options.D: Give way at the roundabout

explanation: Keep well back from the vehicle in front. In poor weather, increase following distance to allow more stopping time.

text:
As you approach the
roundabout, you want to
change lanes. What routine
should you follow?
Video.

options.A: Mirrors, signal, manoeuvre
options.B: Manoeuvre, mirrors, signal
options.C: Manoeuvre, signal, mirrors
options.D: Signal, mirrors, manoeuvre

explanation: The driver failed to look properly at the junction. The crash occurred because the driver didn't check thoroughly before emerging.

text:
You want to travel on the
A61. Which lane should you
use at the roundabout?
Video.

options.A: Either the left lane or middle lane
options.B: Only the left lane
options.C: Only the middle lane
options.D: Either the middle lane or right lane

explanation: Look well ahead and anticipate hazards. Good hazard perception means scanning ahead and predicting potential dangers.

text:
Why has the bus driver
positioned the bus on the
left?
Video.

options.A: The sign on the roundabout is directing traffic to 'keep left'
options.B: In case the pedestrian wants to get on the bus
options.C: The bus needs extra room to get around the roundabout
options.D: To get a better view of the roundabout

explanation: The pedestrian was hidden by the parked car. Parked vehicles can obstruct your view of pedestrians about to cross.

text:
Why does the cyclist
take the longer route around
the roundabout?
Video.

options.A: It's easier to give arm signals while you're on the left
options.B: Cyclists may keep to the left for safety
options.C: The cyclist is riding into a one-way street
options.D: To avoid being dazzled by the sun

explanation: Be patient and wait for a safe opportunity. Never overtake unless you have a clear, safe view ahead.

text:
What do the yellow lines
along the edge of the road
mean?
Video.

options.A: No waiting
options.B: Pedestrians shouldn't cross where there are yellow lines
options.C: They mark the edge of the road
options.D: They are rumble strips

explanation: Move to the left to give more room. When a large vehicle is alongside, increase the gap by moving away from it.

text:
Why is it dangerous to
overtake near a junction?
Video.

options.A: You'll be in the blind spot of the driver waiting to emerge
options.B: The road surface will be slippery
options.C: A driver waiting to emerge might not see you
options.D: Your signal would be hard to see

explanation: Check mirrors more frequently. In busy traffic, more frequent mirror checks help you stay aware of surrounding vehicles.

text:
What is the speed limit
on this road for the car
towing the caravan?
Video.

options.A: 50 mph
options.B: 60 mph
options.C: 30 mph
options.D: 40 mph

explanation: The traffic island forces drivers to slow down. Traffic calming features like islands are designed to reduce vehicle speeds.
